12431.content:
It took Margot Francois a while to put herself together in the mornings, which was the way she liked it. She liked to use her morning routine to help sort through the various problems and challenges she faced, and come to a solution. After all, who was going to sort her problems out if not herself?

She'd just gotten out of the bath and was styling her golden blonde hair as her mind turned towards one such problem that had been bothering her for a while. Like all children of the nobility who attended the Citadel Preparatory Academy, one of Margot's goals was to interface with the other children of important magical families in search of a marriage alliance. It was a surprisingly feudal way of matchmaking, but both Margot's parents had met during their schooling at the Citadel, so she supposed it worked.

Margot's problem was that her pedigree just happened to be one of the best in the school. The Francois family could trace its lineage all the way back to Francis of Normandy, who had been Court Wizard to the Holy Roman Emperor Charlemagne. As such, many of the young men vying for Margot's hand were, quite frankly, not worth her time. Few students at the Academy were. There had been one she'd had her eye on, but just thinking about the memory brought a frown to Margot's face.

Antonio de Panettone had been in line to become the Duke of Milan when he'd begun his schooling at the Citadel, and had actually gotten the title when his father had unexpectedly died during his last year. Seeing the advantage of the match, Margot had spent much of her time at the Citadel trying to woo him, only to be beaten out by Cerulea de la Mar. Last she'd heard the two had gotten married right after graduation. Just the thought of having wasted all that time made Margot's blood boil.

Which brought her back to a display she'd seen last night, at the welcoming feast; the impromptu eating contest between Azul, Cerulea's little sister, and some peasant she hadn't bothered to learn the name of. An eating contest that had been judged by one Phineas Fortescue. The quiet young man could present an interesting opportunity.

The Fortescues were, after all, one of Europe's most illustrious magical families. No one could say that she'd be marrying down by marrying a Fortescue. She also knew that she'd have an easy time seducing him, if it came to it. Margot wasn't blind, after all. She always made sure to keep an eye on her surroundings, and had seen Phineas staring at the heavier girls in their year (herself included) when he thought no one would see him. Margot smirked as she ran a hand up her plush body. It would seem that her extra fluff was going to be nothing but an advantage for this latest scheme of hers.

But what made Margot truly decide to commit to her plan to seduce Phineas was that it was clear as day that Azul wanted him. The way that she'd deliberately plumped herself up over the summer and that gratuitous display at the welcoming ceremony left no doubt in Margot's mind. She couldn't directly get back at Cerulea, who had stolen the man she wanted, but nabbing the boy her little sister was interested in would be at least some kind of revenge, and Margot supposed she could be satisfied with that.

Finally, her preparations for the day were done. She was wearing a modest blouse with a skirt that was not quite short enough to be considered scandalous. Margot's green eyes twinkled as she flounced out of her room. She'd have Phineas eating out of her hand within a week.

* * * * *

Azul could tell that she and Ruby were in trouble right away. She'd just arrived at Advanced Animation with Phineas and Ruby (the three having coordinated their schedules so that they'd have the same classes), when Margot Francois entered the classroom. She walked right by where they'd been sitting, with a deliberate sway in her wide hips. Phineas had been awestruck, and only looked away after Ruby "accidentally" jostled him. Before sitting down, Margot looked directly at Azul and had shot her a smug smirk.

Azul frowned pensively. She was well aware of the animosity between Margot and her older sister. A big part of the reason she'd been forced to partner with Phineas and Ruby last year had been Margot's efforts to socially isolate her from the other noble children as an indirect way of lashing out at Cerulea. Not that Azul minded; she found that she liked the two people sitting near her much more than the many children of counts, dukes, and bankers that she'd interacted with for the majority of her school career. So Azul had been content to let Margot play her games, since they really had only made her life better once she'd gotten to know Phineas and Ruby better.

But now it looked like Margot was after Phineas, and that Azul couldn't allow. She looked back at her table mates. Phineas was staring down at his desk, muttering something to himself. Meanwhile, Ruby was shooting her a worried look; it looked like she'd reached the same conclusion that Azul had. Azul mouthed the word "Later," and Ruby nodded. There wasn't much they could do now with class starting. But something would have to be done, else Phineas might slip from their grasp forever before they had a chance to tell him how they felt.

The rest of that day proceeded much the same, with Margot never saying anything to the three, but always staying within eyesight. Always doing something that would keep Phineas's chubby chasing eyes on her, whether it be swaying her hips as she walked, surreptitiously pulling out a snack in the middle of class, or once or twice bending down to pick up a pen of hers that had "accidentally" fallen on the floor. It was a maddening experience for Azul, who really couldn't do much to stop the blonde's assault on Phineas's psyche.

Finally, though, classes were ended for the day, and there was some time until dinner. Phineas, Azul, and Ruby all headed off for different parts of the canvas, to try and figure out just what was going on after the day they'd had.
12431.title: Margot Francois

choices: Ruby and Azul scheme to remove Margot from the equation.
Meanwhile, Ruby plucks up the courage to declare her love to Phineas.
Despite the girls' best intentions, Margot gets some alone time with Phineas.
Instead of waging a 2 vs 1 war, Margot enlists some help in wooing Phineas.
124311.content:
After Margot's behavior during their first day of classes it was clear to Azul that she and Ruby were not alone in vying for Phineas's affections. Although Margot's manner of teasing and knowing looks shot Azul's way made it clear that this was just as much an attack against the de le Mar family on account of her sister, Cerulea. Something Azul was not going to let slide.

It was with that determination that Azul made her way up the marble laden steps towards Vinixivue Tower. Each of the dormitories left its impact on the Citadel's surrounding architecture, and the higher one climbed Vinixivue Tower the more opulent the construction. Diamond and gem encrusted stained glass circled the tower, with golden banisters and silver-wrought lattice work that was polished to perfection, especially on the opening week of the term. Centuries old oak made up the big doors to the common room. Azul opened the doors and immediately looked around for her quarry.

The shining, palatial student quarters were quite lavish and large. The year's new students were getting settled by student authorities, several cliques were mingling about and getting reacquainted, old friends trading in-jokes. The blonde Margot Francois wasn't too hard to miss, with her thunder thighs spilling out of her skirt as she sat on a leather armchair next to two of her catty friends eating teacakes.

Margot didn't miss the dusky skinned, brilliantly blue haired Azul as she made her way closer. "Look who it is, Miss de le Mar," Margot giggled, echoed by nearby students. "Missing out on the posh life?"

It was another loaded barb underneath pleasantries. For the first several years of her schooling Azul had roomed in Vinixivue Tower before she had gotten tired of the snobbish games of one-upmanship that permeated the elites of the dorm. It was moving to simpler quarters, Kunok Quarters in fact, that Azul had eventually formed a genuine friendship with Ruby and Phineas.

"Could I have a word," Azul said sourly. "Privately."

"Nothing you wanted to share publicly?" Margot said, faux-taken aback to a new chorus of titters. "I suppose I can honor that request to a former roommate."

Yes, in their younger years Miss Francois and de le Mar had even roomed together, and that thin veneer between politeness and fierce rivalry had existed since then. Azul was happy to have been freed of it since changing her living arrangements but she could still go toe to toe with the most stuck up Vinixivue had to offer.

"Look," Azul began when she and Margot had retreated to a quiet corner of the tower next to the windows overlooking the lower parts of the Citadel, after drawing the chic curtains, "Phineas is my friend and neighbor I truly care about. He's not some piece of meat to sink your claws in over some petty feud."

"I haven't the foggiest what you're suggesting, Azul," Margot kept the same friendly smile, although her tone was anything but.

"Come off it," Azul said, "just because Cerulea was betrothed to Antonio doesn't mean you can take it out on us. I'm not my sister and you don't even know Phineas all that much."

"Oh, you're not your sister," Margot said, true intentions showing, "but you blue haired de le Mar's do let your feminine charms weave their way into the most eligible of relationships." Part of the candid rivalry with Margot and Azul had been the interactions of their lineage, as the exotic de le Mars had often been the upset in several marriage arrangements throughout the year. "Yet it should have been my hand with Antonio before your sister ruined it when he inherited his title. And turnabout is fair play if you're trying to get in with the Foretecues."

"I had no part in the arranged marriage and you know it, it was out of our control," Azul said. It was only a marriage for appearances anyways. Azul didn't want the truth of relationship with her sister Cerulea and Antonio de Panettone getting out. Azul had shared that tidbit to Ruby in confidence on the train, with Cerulea and Antonio incompatible in orientation with Cerulea having a girlfriend. The de le Mar women had far more open minded concepts of relationships than many of the social elite, hence Azul's agreement to share Phineas before Margot stomped her way into the picture.

"Deflect all you want," Margot said, "because I shall have my revenge with wooing Fortescue away from you, and if it secures my relation with one of Europe's most important families that's the cherry on top."

"You barely know him," Azul challenged.

Margot smugly put one hand to her outset hips, brushing her other hand over the edge of her skirt with her tremendous thighs. "Oh, I know what little Phineas fancies." Besides her stellar lineage, Margot was quite attractive if on the heavy side. Hers was a classic rubenesque figure with wide hips and filled thighs, perhaps the one flaw in the eyes of any other potential suitor but a boon to enchant the heart of the shyest Fortescue lad.

Margot stepped to the side with a pointed look to check Azul's profile. "And while that ass of yours looks a little more porky, I must outweigh you by what, fifteen? Twenty pounds? You've seen the way he lusts after the biggest." She squeezed her plump thigh for emphasis.

Azul fumed.

"And while Mr. Fortescue doesn't look like much now, he could do with some polishing up. Admit it, I'd be better for him in every way. Really, that display of yours and your silly other friend at the Welcoming Feast was a hopeless attention grab, whatshername is such a lower class lout."

"Ruby Summers," Azul corrected.

"Who?" Margot replied, the name not even worth her notice.

"I swear to you, Margot," Azul challenged, "mess with Phineas or my friend and you will come to regret it! I'll show you just how 'meddlesome' a de le Mar can be."

"I'd like to see you try," Margot retorted.

There was an electric stare between the two young witches before Azul turned to leave. "Just remembered I did warn you, Margot."

"See you at class, then," Margot finished. "Unless dinner tonight will have a repeat performance."

Azul knew she would have to change her strategy with Ruby with Margot entering the game as their opponent.
124311.title: Confrontation in the Tower

choices: The classic approach - both of them need to get fatter than Margot.
Turn the tables - what if they got Margot to quickly lose weight?
Out manipulate her - tank Margot's reputation and occupy her time else ways.
Thick n intimate - Margot can't do much damage if they never leave Phineas alone
1243111.content:
"Margot??" Ruby almost choked on her chocolate. Azul had brought along some fancy chocolates, something from home as a treat to start the new term at the Citadel, as she asked Ruby to meet to update her on the situation.

"That, big-headed, ego-centric," Ruby had several choice words in mind, although Azul shushed her. "--skank, then."

"She certainly intends to meddle," Azul fumed, popped several more chocolates in her mouth. In past year, Azul would have savored the chocolate assortment to let it last a few weeks, but in one sitting she and Ruby had nearly polished off the extra large box. As to their original intention, both of Phineas' friends had upped their snacking, although that motivation went into overdrive now that there was an outside competitor in the mix.

"Why does stupid, Miss Perfect High-and-Mighty-Toitier than thou," Ruby talked with her mouth full of chocolate, enraged to the point of spitting but wouldn't because of the delicious chocolate, "even see in Phineas? She's never even given him the time of day."

"I know," Azul said, having not told Ruby the full story of Morgot's twisted aims of vengeance. A fact that would complicate their own aims at sharing Phineas' affections. "The real problem is I think she's right on outweighing me, perhaps both of us. When's the last time you weighed yourself?"

Ruby swallowed. "Um, before I left home I was nearly 12 stone." Even though her goal had been to gain more weight to be more attractive in her love's eyes, Ruby wasn't used to the idea of scrutinizing her size just yet.

"Only that much?" Azul was surprised, taking in Ruby's appearance. With all of her weight concentrated in the middle, the freckled redhead's pudgy figure was dominated by her doughy belly. That plumpness had left Azul thinking Ruby outweighed her, until she took in account their difference in heights. "Because I'm not even twelve and a half stone."

Ruby's eye grew wide at that metric, as she reciprocated Azul's sizing up as she looked to her friend's taller, exotic form. Azul was a knock with her namesake blue hair and eyes with how they contrasted her darker skin. And while she had the bulbous backside, there wasn't that much fat on the upper parts of her body.

"So I'm the smallest in all of this?" Ruby asked, ashamed.

"There, there," Azul gave her friend a comforting squeeze on the shoulder. "You'll outpace me soon enough with that appetite of yours. What's more concerning is that places Margot close to 200 pounds if she's telling the truth."

Ruby felt her heart sinking, as she reached for more chocolate.

"She may be the biggest now," Azul said, "but we have the advantage of being friends with Phineas. We can keep her from trying to charm him and play to our strengths."

"Right," Ruby said, confidence returning.

"The sooner we can get rid of her influence, the better," Azul said. The two friends began planning their strategy in this all out game of love and war.
1243111.title: Preemptive Payback

choices: Soon, Ruby and Azul both declare their love and aims to Phineas.
Smothered by the girls, Phineas breaks away, snared by another weighty beauty.
The pair can't prepare for each eventuality; Margot seizes her chance to woo!
Sharing Phineas soon becomes lopsided, does Ruby or Azul come out ahead?
12431114.content:
"If we're both in this together," Ruby said after she and Azul had finished the chocolate, "then that'll be our source of strength, two against one." In some respects Ruby had spent the past couple of days coming to terms with the idea of sharing Phineas. It was fun to talk about the matters with Azul yet some part of Ruby had still pined for Phineas as a solo act of courtship. This had thrown her off her game, especially as Margot Francois stated her intent to interfere, leaving Ruby a bit weepy in the process of understanding what was going on.

Now that she knew Azul had the best of intentions to confession their joint love for Phineas, unlike Margot, it grounded Ruby back to her fierce Summers determination. Plenty had looked down on her origins before, working class compared to most of the blue bloods at the Citadel (if not blue-haired like Miss de le Mar) but that grit and gumption had got her this far into her schooling, about to ask Phineas out herself before the approach became sideways.

"It'll be like nursing new babes back at the farm," Ruby suggested. Her family earned most of their income domesticating various magical beasts. "Whenever there's a unicorn foal or a hod pup born, we're there alongside the mother. Doubly so if it's a rescue."

"So neither of us should leave Phineas alone?" Azul summarized.

"Yeah, preferably both of us should be with him as much as possible so Margot can't get to him. And if we need to switch one of us should be available as the other departs. That could free up time to continue our efforts."

"And for school, of course," Azul said, earning a titter between them. Their schemes still became the forefront of their thoughts as they continued discussion. "I might have a word with the professors about switching my classes around. That'll also let me see if I can sus out Margot's schedule."

"You wouldn't happen to have more chocolates, would you?" Ruby asked, feeling peculiarly famished. Her height didn't do much for her stature, although her robust appetite would soon be dramatic results to catching up to the metaphorical "heavyweights" in terms of Margot as a rival and Azul as a co-girlfriend.

"Sorry, but I'll order some more," Azul said, as she continued with their options. "We have the advantage of sharing a dorm so we can always convince him to come back for a study session. Or more. Maybe we can join in on a club Margot will avoid."

"Good ideas," Rub said, mind elsewhere. "My parents packed some cookies in a care package, I feel like a taste of home."


As a new addition to her morning regimen, Margot Francois added scrying after she had done up her blonde locks into bouncy ringlets. She had somewhat of a skill in divination, although most matters of the future at the Citadel were tricky to determine given the magical wards built into the foundation of the school, along with the sheer potential of its students. However, Margot could still determine something as simple as which way one Phineas Fortescue walked towards breakfast in the mornings.

"Perfect," Margot said as she mentally noted the results from her crystal ball, taking the moment to do up her stockings. The hem ending just above the knee, it left plenty of flesh for Phineas to feast his eyes on, given how her plump thighs filled out her skirt. An easy way to charm the shy youth. It would be as easy as 'bumping' into him on the way to breakfast.

The execution turned out to not be that simple. Margot considered it a straight shot down from Vinixivue Tower to where she planned to interact Fortescue coming from his dorm. Yet unlike her portents in the crystal ball he wasn't alone.

Azul de le Mar was walking beside him, cracking jokes in what appeared to be an impromptu pop quiz, as Phineas read out questions from one of his textbooks as they carried their school supplies. And Azul was very pointedly not looking at Margot, although she had crossed to the other side of Phineas as if to block him from view.

Margot frowned. It would require her fallback plan later that day.


"Morning Finny!" Ruby greeted as Azul and Phineas sat at the table.

"Hello," Phineas was a little bleary eyed, having been woken earlier than usual as Azul asked him to help her review material they had learned last year to best prepare for their new classes. "Have you...been at breakfast this whole time?"

There were two emptied plates and a bowl with traces of porridge at Ruby's place setting, as she merrily ate at some bacon. "That early? I guess so, we're often up at the crack of dawn when I help on the farm. Morning chores before getting fuel for the day."

Or in this case for Ruby, the morning chore had been the fuel for the day. She had just about beat out the rest of the Citadel for showing up to breakfast early, her large appetite given a renewed drive to make herself more attractive in the eyes of her metal crush with Azul. Azul smiled knowingly as she tucked into her own breakfast, as Phineas was more careless in keeping his gaze flitted between them for too long.


Not many studied the Law & Government of magical societies to this advanced a degree, so Margot knew that their class was a handful of students, herself and Fortescue included. Margot's machinations for influence weren't only from family reputation alone, as she had political ambitions alongside marrying well, creating her new fascination in luring Fortescue away from her rival.

The small chamber for this class had raised benches and longboards along each wall before the lectern, so as Fortescue entered Margot prepared to shift her weight over a few seats to find a 'new seat mate.'

"Excuse me, apologies for being late." There was de le Mar yet again! Huffing slightly, the bulbous reared blue-haired harlot obvious wasn't used to brisk jogs. She didn't even take this class!

"You don't even take this class," Phineas said after Azul sat down after a word with the professor, although he was pleasantly surprised to see her.

"I know, but I asked to transfer last minute as I've been thinking about what to do after graduation," Azul replied, winded, as she sat her own wide hips closer to Phineas' seat than she had at any of their previous classes. "You make it sound much more interesting, Finny."

He was the only thing that made this interesting. Truthfuly, Azul found the class to be an actual bore, a lot of the material stuff she had learned second hand from her family's own political interests. Azul excelled far more at her spell work than anyone in her family thought, although alliances and clan loyalties were seen as more important. This class was going to be horrendous. But besides more time with Phineas, it was well worth the look on Margot Francois' face when she entered.


"Care for a drink, Phineas?" Ruby asked as the trio of friends met that evening. She had talked Phineas into joining her and Azul out on one of the balconies off of the Kunok Quarters commons. Azul was basking along one of the benches, catching the last of the suns rays, as Ruby pried open the crate she had been carrying.

"Pixie Malt?" Phineas read on the bottle.

"It's a favorite back home," Ruby said, having snuck around some of the Citadel's larders. "Non-alcholoic, don't worry, but it is said to lift your spirits!"

"O-kayy..." Phineas took the bottle. The drink had a warm, fruity, fizzy taste that did make him feel a bit giddy. He took a seat perpendicular to Azul's bench, as Ruby handed her a drink.

"Here's to another great year!" Ruby toasted as she cracked open her bottle. "Look at us, think to when we were the young sprouts at the Citadel, and now we are much more mature."

An odd message but Phineas raised his bottle all the same before taking another swig. Things sure were different than when they were younger, when he hadn't gotten to know Ruby or Azul personally. But it was odd how much of the day they had spent together already...

He was distracted in noticing that while he and Azul had taken a sip, Ruby had raised her head back over the railing as she continued drinking, great gulps passing from her throat down past her chest to her stomach. And drinking, and drinking...

"AHH!" Ruby gasped, refreshed, after finishing off her Pixie Malt in one long draft. Phineas looked stunned as Azul laughed. "I could go for another, there's plenty more if anyone wants." She stooped to fish out another bottle.

Azul had been surprised how forward Ruby had been in this endeavor but it was looking to pay off. If they kept this up, they would secure Phineas' heart in no time. It was almost a shame this side of Kunok Quarters didn't face Vinixivue Tower, because this evening's exhibitions would send Margot a clear message.


There may not have been direct line of sight but Margot fumed over her crystal ball over her evening scrying, as she began to plot.
12431114.title: The Fourth Wheel

choices: "... Josiah Evergreen." A wizard three times older than her!
"... Louis Francois." The awfullest boy in Vinixvue Tower!
"... Carmine Vermillion." Her own cousin, seriously?
"... Phineas Fortescue." Wait, what?
12432.content:
It had been three weeks since the school year started, and Azul thought that things were going well. Her classes, while challenging, were not too difficult. She'd managed to slide back into the partnership she'd shared with Phineas and Ruby with little trouble. And, of course, the plot to share Phineas was moving along as well. Azul knew it was going to take time, but she felt that the polyamorous relationship she envisioned among the three of them would soon be a reality.

But it would appear that reality was going to impose its wishes upon her rather than the other way around, as Azul found herself sitting in a private room in the administration wing wearing one of her formal robes. It had been made for her at the beginning of the school break, which was why it felt rather tight around her bust and hips. It certainly seemed to catch Phineas's attention when she had told her friends about the meeting she needed to attend this morning. A meeting with someone she'd rather not see right now.

It wouldn't surprise Azul that Lord Cobal de la Mar would be late to a meeting he'd arranged with his own daughter. The man was always busy with his duties, and what time he did find to spare seemed to be spent on Azul's two older sisters. A part of her had wondered if he'd noticed her steadily putting on weight the entire time she'd been back home during the break. He apparently didn't, not that she'd really expected him to.

Finally, he deigned to appear. Lord Cobal's hair was the same shade of blue he'd passed down to his daughters, albeit streaked through with grey. The man's face was clean-shaven and severe, with age lines starting to etch their way into it. His robe was lighter shade of blue, marked with the wave emblem of the de la Mar family. At his side was his wife, the Lady Sarah de la Mar, wearing a robe similar to the one her husband wore. She lacked the dusky coloring and blue hair of the family she'd married into, but it was thankfully the softer features of her face that Azul had inherited.

"I apologize for the delay, Azul," Cobal said as the two of them sat down.

"It's understandable, my Lord Father. I know that your time is valuable," Azul responded, with a little more venom in the last word than she had intended.

If her father noticed, he didn't show it. "Indeed. As you know, my daughter, our family has kept its position over the centuries by marrying well. Your eldest sister, Sapphire, and her husband are set to inherit Isle de la Mar. Cerulea has married the Duke of Milan."

Azul didn't like where the conversation was going. "I know, Father. And I am looking for a similarly prestigious match."

"Are you?" Cobal asked, "Because it is my understanding that you moved out of Vinixvue Tower last year."

Azul could feel a lead weight in her stomach. After she'd started working with Phineas and Ruby, she'd requested a transfer to Kunok Quarters. It was partly so they'd have an easier time collaborating in their classes (that was the reason she'd put on the paperwork), but mainly so that she could get away from the other noble children she'd never really gotten along with. But of course, it was those noble children her father would want her to be interacting with.

Cobal continued speaking, his face as stony as ever. "I would have been content to allow you to try and find a prospective husband, as I had for your sisters. But leaving Vinixvue has lead me to question your judgement in the matter. So your mother and I have decided to make the decision for you, so that you may focus your attention on your schooling."

Azul looked from her father to her mother, but Lady Sarah's expression remained unreadable. Of course, what could her mother say? In the end, Cobal was the head of the household, the patriarch of the family, and his word was law. Once he'd made a decision, it was final. Only rarely did Cobal de la Mar change his mind once it was made up. Azul could feel something inside her shatter, as her dreams for a future together with the two people she loved most in the world were revealed to be just that: dreams.

"Of course. Thank you, Father, Mother," Azul said in a quietly defeated voice, because what else was there to say? "And who is my husband going to be?"

Cobal gave a satisfied nod, either not noticing his daughter's distress or not caring. "The name of the man you've been engaged to is...
12432.title: The Betrothal of Azul de la Mar

choices: Ruby seems to take the news well.
Ruby is heartbroken at the announcement.
Ruby feels outright betrayed by Azul.
124324.content:
Azul felt her heart stop for a moment. Had she heard he father right?

"Come again?" she asked, her voice almost coming out as a squeak.

"Phineas Fortescue," Cobal repeated. "It should prove an ideal match. He is in your year, I believe. When I asked your sisters for their input on potential matches, his was the first name mentioned by both of them."

It took everything she had not to break down crying right there. Azul knew she would need to pull out all the stops to thank both Sapphire and Cerulea for this; if it wasn't for their strategically-placed suggestions to father, she might have been truly trapped in an unbearable situation. She looked up and saw Cobal looking at her and realized he was probably waiting for her answer on something. Not trusting her voice for the moment, she simply nodded at him.

"Very good," Cobal said with a satisfied nod. "I believe that concludes everything we needed to discuss with you." After that, it was the perfunctory goodbyes, which Azul managed to struggle through with a straight face (though her mother sent her a concerned look). Once the elder de la Mars were out of the room, Azul took a moment to let the tears of relief wash out of her. She knew she couldn't stay in the room forever though, and left to see if she could find a more private place to break down in.

Meanwhile, Phineas Fortescue was leaving a different room in the administration wing after facing a similar meeting with his own father about his future. The reedy young wizard was feeling conflicted. There was definitely a part of him that didn't like the fact that his father had decided as important an aspect of his future as who he was going to marry. At least it was going to be to Azul, he supposed. He wasn't entirely sure if the blue-haired witch liked him as more than a friend, though there was a corner of his brain that suspected that maybe she did.

He put those musings on hold when he saw the witch in question in the corridor in front of him. Phineas picked up the pace to a light jog to catch up to her. His heart sank when he saw the puffiness of her eyes and some tear tracks down her cheeks, clear evidence that she'd been crying. Was she sad about the arrangement, Phineas wondered. She was so caught up in her own head that she hadn't noticed him yet, so Phineas loudly cleared his throat to catch her attention.

"I'm guessing... you learned about the... uh... the engagement?" Phineas asked.

Azul nodded, caught a little off guard by Phineas appearing next to her.

"I just... I want to know that... If this isn't something you want, we can... we'll figure something out..." Phineas said, but before he could continue his rambling mess of an answer, Azul grabbed him by the front of his robes and kissed him on the mouth. Thankfully, the hallway was empty, so no one was around to witness Phineas become the speechless one. After the kiss ended, Phineas merely continued to stare back at Azul, still not able to form words.

"I... I've been waiting to do that for months now. None of this is going to how I planned it, but... I'm glad, Phineas. I'm glad it's you." Azul said after it was clear Phineas wouldn't be able to form words on his own.

It took the dark-haired young wizard a little more time to put his thoughts back into working order. "You mean... You're fine with..."

"Yes, Phineas, I am. Truth be told, I've been trying to find a way to tell you for a while now. I love you, Phineas Fortescue," Azul responded.

Phineas wasn't quite sure how to respond to that, so he simply pulled his fiancée into an embrace. The two remained there for a time, before Phineas said, "I, uh... I think we should get going. Ruby's going to wonder where we are."

"Ruby..." Azul felt the lead weight in her stomach return. She'd been so elated over this unexpected turn of events that she'd forgotten the girl whom she'd promised to share Phineas with. The girl who she was fairly certain she loved as much as she loved Phineas. There was no telling how she might respond to the news of this engagement, but the consequences for putting off telling her might end up being catastrophic. Ruby Summers and Azul de le Mar had believed, with the talk on the train about the pounds they gained over the break since last year, and the impromptu eating contest at the welcoming feast, that Phineas would pick up on their genuine enthusiasm for gaining weight, which they knew as his fetish. That they were open to turning their friendship into something more.

Unfortunately, the morning after the eve of the new term did little to reciprocate the plans the two girls had to declare shared love towards Phineas. Azul had gone to breakfast with a new outfit, having eyed her wardrobe to find which clothes had the most give, settling for a silky soft pink blouse and taunt silvery skirt, a contrast to her unusual shade of skin. The skirt clung to her generous curves, leaving her cherubic buttocks on display in a tantalizing fashion.

Ruby did not have as many clothes as her friend's lavish wardrobe, although she had a patterned vest and work slacks that would be suitable for their classes. More importantly, a bit painfully, the results of her victory at last night's eating contest still sat heavy in her stomach. It would be worth the pain, Ruby knew, if it got Phineas to reciprocate her feelings.

Thus the pair walked in tandem to a table where Phineas was sitting, a textbook opened next to his breakfast plate. Each girl positively beamed and the prospects of showing off to their friend turned potential lover.

"Good morning, Phineas!" Azul greeted, striking a pose once she reached the table. "What do you think of my outfit?" She specifically stood in side profile as she stretched, her long deep blue hair cascading the small of her back, knowing that the impressive curve of her hip and rear would be undeniable.

"You look, um, swell!" Phineas said, suddenly nervous. Having debated his friends motivations last night, he had written off their potential of meaning to gain weight. He was happy to have the two girls as friends and classmates going into their penultimate year, and would rather not risk losing them as friends even if he had imagined them getting fatter a few times before.

Still in disbelief of this change in his friends, Phineas quickly looked back to his text on the properties of magical minerals to avoid gawking.

Taken aback, Azul looked to Ruby before taking a seat, displeased that her showing off didn't have the desired reaction.

"*oof*" Ruby lowed herself into a seat gently, playing up her performance from the welcoming feast. "I'm still feeling stuffed, I ate too much last night." She rubbed her stomach for emphasis and to relieve some pressure.

"Hmm," Phineas grunted noncommittally, willing all of his effort to keep reading the classification of metallic alloys on the page of his textbook.

"I guess that's what you get for overeating," Azul teased jokingly, although there was no malice among the conspirators to jointly sway Phineas Fortescue's heart. "I may have lost last night but I'm feeling rather famished this morning. As you would say, Ruby, having a hearty breakfast?"

Phineas felt the sweat form on the back of his neck over the sounds of Azul loading up her plate with each type of food the breakfast table had to offer, as his eyes bored into the page he had not turned in minutes.

"Now that's hardly fair!" Ruby said, making her own effort to build a breakfast plate even if her stomach complained about being full. "You have such form and grace, Azul, and those good genetics that I'm sure anything you eat only settles in your lower half tastefully."

"Guilty as charged," the de la Mar daughter grinned.

"Meanwhile, I'm so stoutly built that everything just settles in the middle." Ruby was looking intently at Phineas now, trying to catch his eye, further kneading her taunt belly at the risk of having to belch again. "I'd hardly be able to make it to my Practical Enchantments course."

Phineas, ready to explode internally and getting hard just at the odd recognition of was was said, suddenly bolted from his seat needing to find a cool spot to think before he embarrassed himself. "Well, sorry to run, Ruby, Azul, see you all in Advanced Alchemy?"

He rushed out of there carrying his books low to block a stiffie, leaving the girls to bemoan his obliviousness.

"How could he not react to anything?" Azul sighed, forking her plate of eggs, sausage, toast and hash and eating in big bites out of frustration.

"Finny is hopeless when he gets stuck in his own head," Ruby said glumly, familiar with how Phineas exercised care to make sure his lustful looks towards the chunky females at the Citadel were hidden. "Just teasing him with the talk isn't working, we'll have to hit him over the head with it."

"Indeed," Azul said after swallowing some grapefruit juice from a goblet. "What classes do we all share this term? He'll have to notice eventually."

Ruby and Azul spent the rest of the breakfast topping off as they examined their schedules, plotting new ways to get Phineas to see the truth of their efforts.

* * * *


The next phase of their plan took place in Advanced Alchemy in second period. Ruby and Azul deliberately directed Phineas towards a work station on the side of the classroom, next to a wall of cabinets and shelves stocked with materials the students used for alchemical coursework.

"Remember how we aced Intermediate Alchemy last year together?" Ruby beamed. "We're unstoppable team because we know each other so well."

"Quite so," Azul continued, as the class broke out into groups for their first assignment. Phineas was practically pinned between the two beauties as they took seat on either side of him.

Azul looked at their syllabus. "Now let's begin: we'll first need a copy of Restricted Processes For Improved Alchemical Redistribution on the top shelf."

"I'll get it!" Ruby loudly announced. The choice of student for the task was completely impractical. Shorter than the average, other students could easily reach the shelf where the texts for their grade of studies were kept by Ruby ended up falling short. She stretched and stretched with her arm, making a show of it, her plumped up midriff becoming bare as her clothes shifted, unable to cover her increased girth.

Phineas was confused. "Shouldn't I help you--?"

"Got it!" Ruby announced, having worked the book off the high shelf with her fingers. She was breathing heavily, winking at Phineas as her belly grew out and in with each breath, having yet to tug down her vest as she took her seat.

"And for the transmutation will need a block of marble and a lead plate, I can get that," Azul said. Sitting on the far side away from the supply cabinet, her getting up and brushing past Phineas and Ruby made even less sense than Ruby being tasked with the top shelf. The ingredients were in the bottom cabinet, causing Azul to stoop low to retrieve them.

The act was a deliberate ploy to emphasize her expanded rear, as the twin cheeks of her lovely rounded bum tested the limits of her skirt. She risked bumping her butt into the faces of her friends. The other downside to reaching for the heavy base materials was that Azul, having a pampered life, didn't have as strong of muscle tone as Ruby's stout build. She struggled to lift the marble block and lead plate together, butt flexing with each failed attempt to right herself

"Maybe just one at a time?" Phineas suggested, his brain currently at critical confusion as to what had come over Azul and Ruby's actions.

"Of course," Azul breathed heavily, her dusky skin hiding the beads of sweat that had formed on her face from the exertion.

Again, she brushed past Ruby and Phineas to return to her seat, the two girls nearly squishing Phineas they were sitting so close. The rambunctious display of exhibitionism had failed to capture Phineas's attention again, as he hurried himself in the alchemy assignment after the materials were gathered.

The rest of the day proved fruitless. From trying to have Phineas get a feel for their bodies in a midday Dueling course, to playing up how hungry the schooling made them at lunch, to trying to explain what love Phineas had in his future during a Divination Symposium, nothing got through Phineas' thick skull that not only did his best friends have feelings for him, they also shared in his kink. By supper the girls were desperate.

"Should we just tell him?" Ruby said after Phineas had failed to show for the evening meal. "I mean, privately, of course. He's too nervous in public displays."

Azul drummed her well manicured fingers on the table. "If he's panicking at our teases, I don't know if he could take an outright declaration of love. Even if jointly presented. He'll probably not want to hurt either of our feelings." Phineas' lack for social graces and lack of self esteem were becoming hindrances for the girls' efforts. It would be torture keeping this up for an entire semester if Phineas never got the hint.

"I think we'll have to step up our game," Azul suggested.

Ruby took some time to compose her thoughts before she said, "I think we need to give him some more time."

Azul raised a skeptical eyebrow at her friend, and gestured with her hand to continue.

"It's just... I think we both know that Finny doesn't like talking about himself. I think he's been denying what he really wants for so long that he's not sure how to talk about it. And I think it's important that he needs to figure out how to do that," Ruby said. "I don't think trying to force an answer out of him is going to be healthy for any of us."

Azul let out a frustrated sigh. "Ah, you're probably right. I guess I'm so used to having an easy solution for any problem at hand that I didn't really think there might not be one in this case. I guess we just have to keep at it. I mean, he's definitely interested. I saw his expression when you brushed up against him in Dueling this morning."

Ruby grinned and replied, "He couldn't keep his eyes off your butt in Advanced Alchemy! It's like he was in a trance!"

"It is a well-known fact that the butts of the de la Mar family have induced trances in many people. It's one of our most infamous family magics," Azul said in a faux-haughty tone. She was able to keep her serious expression for a few more minutes before it dissolved into giggles along with Ruby.

After catching her breath, Ruby said, "Maybe we should lighten up a little on the teasing, though."

"Maybe," Azul conceded. "But you know what we shouldn't lighten up on?" As she spoke, Azul cast a minor teleportation spell, transporting a just-finished cheesecake from the Citadel Kitchens to the table near the girls.

Ruby stared at the confection for a moment, before looking back at Azul. "You gotta show me how to do that."

"I guess I should," Azul responded. "Because this one's all mine!"

Phineas decided that life was going okay for now. The first day of classes back at the Citadel had been kind of weird, but afterwards Ruby and Azul seemed to go back to normal.

Well, not quite normal. While they definitely weren't doing so as much as they had on that first day back, there were instances in the day where one of them would do something... distracting. Phineas tried his best to be a gentleman, he really did! But when Azul leaned over in such a way that Phineas got an eyeful of her cleavage, or Ruby used her hips to close a door due to her arms being full, it was hard not to be distracted! The weirdest part was when he caught one or both of them noticing him staring. He expected to be told off or slapped or something, but nothing ever came of it!

And then there was the food.

Neither Azul nor Ruby had ever been the skinniest girls in his class. Even last year, they both had had eaten well, not subscribing to the diets that those students who wanted to lose weight went on. But this year, it was like they couldn't get enough. Hearty breakfasts, heavy lunches, seconds at dinnertime, and plenty of snacks to graze on when they studied, wether as a group or solo. And it was definitely starting show.

Ruby's had always had a figure that the more polite students would call "stout," and now it was beginning to round out. Her belly was acquiring more mass, though it could be hard to tell how big it naturally was sometimes due to the fact that Ruby was constantly stuffing herself. The real expansion was happening down below, with Ruby's enlarging hips, thighs, and butt giving her a pear shape. Not to say that the rest of her wasn't getting softer, but that wasn't where the main show was.

Azul, meanwhile, was widening on both top and bottom. Phineas had overheard her talking to Ruby about needed to be fitted for a bigger bra, and her bustline definitely seemed to be expanding. At the same time, her hips were also getting wider and softer, giving her more of an hourglass shape. Like Ruby, her belly was usually kept full, but it didn't seem to be expanding at the same rate the redhead's was. It wouldn't be unfair to call her downright Rubenesque these days.

Overall, Phineas was conflicted. The two of them were definitely getting fatter. They had to know, right? Except that there wasn't any of the usual complaining about gaining weight that Phineas had heard from most of his heavier classmates. In fact, they seemed... fine with it? Or were they just in denial? If they were, then it was Phineas's job as their friend to talk about it with them, wasn't it? Only, even someone with as little social grace as Phineas knew that asking a girl about her weight was not what one did. And then of course there was that more lustful part of him that wanted to see just how big his friends would get.

It was a lot to think through.

So, things continued on as they had. Phineas, Ruby, and Azul continued working together in their classes. The girls continued to flirt with the confused young man, and continued to eat themselves bigger. And Phineas continued to be confused, wondering just what he was missing. This tenuous status quo finally changed during one of the last weekends of summer, when...

1243411.content:
It all started on a Friday evening after dinner. Phineas, Ruby, and Azul had been studying for an exam they were going to have in their Alchemical Potioneering class next week for close to two hours, and the snacks that were now the a fixture girls' study sessions were starting to run low. This was all after an already tough week; their schoolwork was getting more difficult, the girls were getting more frustrated at Phineas's obliviousness, and Phineas was at a loss when trying to understand their behavior.

Finally, Ruby set down her textbook and groaned, "That's it. I'm done."

Azul set her book aside too. "Agreed. I don't think another hour of this is going to be helpful at all."

Phineas was the last to put his down and said, "Yeah, I guess that's enough for one night. But we've still got that project we need to do for Extraplanar Studies and that essay on river monsters for Supernatural Creatures." He winced when he heard his friends let out dejected sighs, and even he had to admit he was starting to get a little burned out. He glanced out a nearby window as the sky began to darken, the sun having already dipped below the horizon, and had an idea. "But..."

"But what?" Azul asked after Phineas took a little too long to organize his thoughts.

"But, if we could get all that stuff done tomorrow... then that means we'd have a free Sunday," Phineas said. "The weather's supposed to be pretty good, I think. We could just hang out down by the lake or something."

"A day by the beach, huh? How.. forward of you," Azul said with a smirk and a suggestive eyebrow waggle.

Before Phineas could get too distracted, Ruby interjected, "It feels like its been ages since I've been swimming. I like this plan. Tomorrow's gonna suck, but we can handle it, can't we?"

"W-we definitely can!" Phineas responded. Though, as it would turn out, Ruby's prediction was true. Saturday did indeed suck, since essay-writing had never been the strong suit of Phineas or Azul. Thankfully Ruby had gotten a knack for it (she'd qualified for her scholarship thanks in part to her writing skills), and with her help they managed to get the papers done without needing to resort to outright plagiarism (not that any of the three would stoop to something like that!). The rest of the day was spent on their group project for Extraplanar Studies. It wasn't complete by any means, but they'd made enough progress that they could justify taking a day off.

Sunday dawned with all three of the friends sleeping in and sharing a late brunch. Then it was back to Kunok to get changed, before they headed down to the lake. The official name for the body of water was Citadel Lake, although it was also often referred to as Challenge Lake or Conjure Lake. The story, as Phineas had heard it, was that few centuries back two rather talented students had challenged each other to see who could summon the best thing. Both had independently decided to summon a huge amount of water from one of the elemental planes, and the result had been the creation of a large lake in what had once been a valley. These days, the lake was one of the premier places for students from the nearby school to unwind.

The lakeshore was indeed crowded by Sunday afternoon, but it didn't take too much time for the three to find a semi-secluded spot under a big tree. The three set up a picnic blanket there, and with a snap of her fingers Azul caused a large spread of cheeses, crackers, salamis, small sandwiches, and even a few drinks to appear.

"Seriously, how do you do that?" Ruby growled with a glare at Azul. "I know you're using Tinsal's Timeless Transportation, but that spell only works if you know where the object you're going to teleport is going to be ahead of time!"

Azul merely gave Ruby a cheeky smile and bit into a sandwich.

"Well... maybe she already knows where the food is going to be," Phineas suggested. "Maybe because someone's been letting her know?"

Azul's tried to keep her poker face up, but soon relented. "All right, you got me. I did some favors for the kitchen staff a few years back, and in return when I ask them to they put some extra food on one table in the corner of the kitchen that I marked with a magic circle. Once it's there, I can bring it anywhere."

"That's cheating!" Ruby said in mock outrage, which lasted only long enough for her to begin eating a second sandwich (she'd eaten her first during Azul's explanation). Azul merely stuck out her tongue at the redhead before getting back to her lunch. Soon, the spread had been demolished, and the three spent some time just sitting and chatting about nothing in particular.

Soon enough, Ruby declared that she wanted to go swimming and Azul agreed. The two removed the outer clothes they'd been wearing to reveal the swimsuits beneath. Phineas felt his mouth go dry, and he swallowed. Both Ruby and Azul were wearing bikinis (Ruby's in green and Azul's in red), and there was no denying just how large both of his friends had become. He found it impossible to tear his eyes away from their overripe curves.

"S-so," Ruby said (trying to project confidence she didn't really feel at the moment), "How do we look?"

"Uh... great. Stunning... uh..." Phineas's brain was trying to kick itself back into gear, but it looked like his more lustful side wasn't going to let that happen anytime soon.

"I think he needs a minute," Azul murmured to Ruby, smiling. She then shouted, "Join us in the water when you're ready, Finny!" She then headed into the lake, her wide hips and backside swaying.

"Yeah! We'll be waiting!" Ruby added, following Azul.

Phineas remained on the beachside for some time, trying desperately to do something. Anything! Unfortunately, the event that would prod him back into motion was not going to be pleasant, for Phineas or for the two girls secretly in love with him.

A few yards from shore, Ruby and Azul could be heard yelping and splashing happily during their post lunch swim. A few yards from the water's edge, Phineas was doing his best to remember to breathe.

His mind had paused to play out that heavenly image of his two best friends in their swimsuits since putting on some weight after the start of term. The moment he remembered the physique of one of his friends, the other silhouette would enter his mind's eye. Given his predilections, it was hard for him to subjectively say who wore their bikini the best.

Ruby, ruddy-skinned and stout framed, had her stomach and hips wide with her increased poundage. The simple, green bikini stood out against her freckled skin as the bottoms pinched her lower rolls. Her gut and thighs, acquiring most of her mass, now formed two rolls underneath her smaller but still swollen chest, the bikini tied off above the swell of her belly. Her gain was undeniable from the back view as well she wadded into the lake, her back ripples of fat and her broad, doughy rear testing the limits of her bottoms because of her thick legs.

Azul, black-skinned and blue-haired, had her red swimsuit as a sharp contrast to her usual color scheme. Her build could be considered the more conventional bikini babe, although rather outsized to other beach-goers. Her breasts had filled out tremendously and her ripe, juicy rear was inflated yet kept its signature de le Mar alluring shape. These exaggerated curves also had a potbelly between them, not as large as Ruby's of course, but a swell of a stomach that indicated that Azul's gain was not limited only to her hourglass curves. And the way her butt had bounced when she entered the water!

Every bulge, every shimmy was burned into Phineas' retinas as he sat there in heat, forgetting that the point to this excursion was the chance to swim and have fun after a busy week of classes at the Citadel. The exhibition of his friends, the two blimping beauties, had so overtaken Phineas he appeared unable to take the metaphorical and literal plunge into the lake to join them, affirming his feelings towards them.

"Phineas, Phineas..."

Had they said his name when they left to swim? Yes. His mental imagine of Ruby and Azul's plumped, natural beauty echoed his name as he lost himself to his delusions. Time seemed to rewind as he would track the wobble of their curves as they back-walked out of the lake, turning again towards him, then the scene of them heading off to swim would play out again.

"Phineas! Phineas!"

He had the best friends in the world! It was as if a deep truth had been revealed, at once their intentions were made clear towards him. The bulging beauties, Ruby with her hefty appetite and Azul with her rubenesque padding, both gaining weight for their delight and his delight. Their figures had reached out, inviting him, the turn of their bodies where he could see every fold of new fat on the forms spun about. Their love towards him. Their eagerness to please him. Their abject terror.

"PHINEAS!"

The dual screams broke Phineas out of his trance. He had been sitting there, dazed by the weighty beauty of his friends, as he looked across the water to see that they were being attacked by a writhing mass of tentacles! The idyllic, waterside vision shattered as the illusion it was as Phineas came to realize that some sort of lake monster was attacking his friends.

"No!" Not as good with his magic in a crisis, Phineas dug for his wand as he flung himself towards the waters edge to rescue his friends.

Underneath the water's surface, like a mirror he could see the long reflection of Ruby and Azul in candid poses, burgeoning bulges taxing their bikinis. "Glad you finally joined us," Azul said, blowing him a kiss. "It's been great swimming, showing off my results to you," Ruby said, patting her stomach.

They were fine? No, Phineas shook off another probe of the invasive mental force playing on his subconscious, now able to recognize the phenomena for what it was. In reality, the girls kicked and grappled with the aquatic limbs that were trying to drag them lower into the lake's depths, the tentacles connecting to a large, blind beast with baleen plates within its horrid mouth.

Phineas gasped, losing some air, as he recognized what the creature was after their extensive study binge the previous day. Having researched river monsters for his Creatures course, he identified the monster as a dwarf freshwater aboleth. The inland cousin to seawater aboleths, leviathans of the deep known to mentally snare the minds of sailors and drag people away to be tortured before they were consumed, minds first.

Let them go! Phineas willed, swimming towards his friends and firing off an agonizing ray in hopes of causing the aboleth to drop one of the girls. The sting caught the creature on one tentacle, its horrid cry digging into Phineas' psyche like a razor, the underwater realm becoming a dizzying display of lakebed, fantasy, and swirling astral images as Phineas felt flung to another time and place.

Phineas bubbled another incantation, aiming to free the girls, feeling himself drown as he was assaulted on both the physical and mental planes by the aboleth's power. He couldn't give up. He couldn't let something bad happen to Ruby and Azul, now that he realized how much they truly meant to him!

As Phineas felt his consciousness draining, squeezed in one of the monster's many appendages, brought before that eyeless face that seared into his soul, he knew this could be the end. Struggle as he might, he didn't know how to save his friends. He nearly blacked out.

And that was when the sea lion swam out of nowhere and thwacked the aboleth on the head with its tail.

Phineas breathed deeply, getting a second wind, even though that should normally be impossible underwater as he was. His senses becoming clear, he felt the odd sensation of gills having grown on his neck, his body adjusting to underwater survival as he felt the aboleth's coarse mucus on his hand. Of course! Aboleth mucus would adapt its victims to an underwater existence for its continued abuse when dragging them away to their lairs. Phineas caught sight of the sea lion again as it launched itself at the aboleth like a torpedo. He could feel the psychic shock of the creature's cry as it was struck, the hit causing it to lose grip on Ruby. Seizing his chance, Phineas swam to catch his friend.

She was unconscious, dead weight but her buoyancy from her body fat making it easy for Phineas to drag her in the water. He saw the sea lion attack the aboleth's main body, always too nimble for the monster to grasp. Taking advantage of this distraction, Phineas caught sight of the tentacle that held Azul and fired off another spell to sever that limb.

Another piercing mental shriek. Phineas gritted his teeth, pushing to reach Azul so he could bring his friends to the surface. They crested out of the water.

"Bad idea!" Phineas wheezed, finding his aquatic mutation from the aboleth mucus making him unable to breathe air normally. Perhaps the girls were similarly affected. Unknowing, he kicked off and swam towards shore now that they were free of the creature. As the water shallowed, he could feel the oppressive wake of the aboleth subside until he felt his mind ultimately clear. Turning back, Phineas saw the creature had vanished, as mysteriously as it had arrived in the lake. 'Conjure Lake' indeed.

Phineas brought Ruby and Azul to the shoreline, keeping them in the water as his fears were confirmed. They too had been cursed by the aboleth, to return them to land would be a death sentence. How exactly were they to get out of this situation?

Amazingly, the sea lion swam up next to them again, carrying in its mouth a hunk of the tentacle from the monster. Bopping it towards shore, the sea lion emerged onto land. To Phineas' astonishment, the animal morphed into a human form! A girl arched out of the sea lion's body, dingy blond hair cascading down her back. Her skin was pale with a slight tinge of grey. Phineas got an eyeful as she turned towards him. She looked to be the size of a sea lion herself with that blubber.

"Eat this," she proffered the flesh of the aboleth. Phineas, tearing his eyes away from her fuller figure, did so. The flesh was horrid, slimy, and disgusting. He felt the change occur over his body as he returned to normal, crawling onto the beach as he gasped for air. He turned back to the sea lion. Or girl? She looked like a Citadel student, clothed in nothing but the pelt of her animal form, as he was bewildered by this development.

"The aboleth flesh removes its curse," said the girl, in an accent Phineas had heard before. That puzzle was for another time, as Ruby and Azul had to be rescued as well. Forcing pieces of the flesh into their mouths in turn, Phineas forced them to chew the antidote. Azul returned to normal sputtering, only Ruby remained breathless.

"Ruby! Ruby!" Without thinking, Phineas leaned to put his lips to hers, giving her air and then pushing his hands under her chest. The life-saving maneuver caused her to cough up water. "Ruby! Azul! Are you both okay?" They muttered weak replies but they were okay.

"Thank you-" Phineas turned to address their rescuer, although he just caught sight of the bulky, grey skinned blonde pull up the entirety of her pelt, again a sea lion as she swam off towards the other side of the lake. As Phineas helped the other girls to their feet, he realized who the girl was.

Her name was Freja. A student a grade behind him he had seen about the school. And what she was he recalled now too, given her sea lion pelt. Phineas had never figured that a selkie attended the Citadel!

Phineas sat in the waiting room outside of the infirmary, trying to get some work done but finding himself distracted. It was the morning after the incident at Citadel Lake. As he waited to see his two friends awake and well again, his mind couldn't help but wander back through the past 12 hours that had gotten him to this point.

After Freja had saved Phineas and his friends from being bound to the water by the aboleth's cursed mucus, he had managed to get the three of them to back to the school. There had been an alarm raised about a monster in the lake, but Phineas had been more concerned about any lasting damage the foul beast might have done to Ruby and Azul. It wasn't long before the three had been brought to the infirmary to be looked over by the skilled healers who worked there.

The prognosis looked optimistic, at least according to the cleric who had looked the three of them over. While the trauma the aboleth had inflicted upon their psyches had been severe, all of them would likely recover no worse for wear. Phineas had been cleared to return to Kunok Quarters for the evening, while Ruby and Azul had been required to stay in the infirmary overnight. The psychic attack on the girls' minds had been much more intense than what Phineas had experienced, and thus the healers had decided to keep them close to monitor their recovery.

Phineas had found sleep elusive after returning to his room. When he had fallen asleep, dreams of dark waters and his friends gasping for breath had woken him up. And that hadn't even been the strangest part of the night, because his mind soon began to wander towards odd ideas. Not unpleasant ones, but odd.

He found himself sitting on a grassy plain he'd never seen before with Ruby. The redhead smiled at him, her brown eyes filled with an intense desire that Phineas couldn't look away from. Ruby closed her eyes, and leaned in towards him. Then he found himself by the sea with Azul, feeding the blue-haired witch a bunch of grapes like she was a Roman noblewoman. Azul reached up, grabbed his arm, and brought him to sit down by her, encouraging him to lean against her. Then he was below the waters of Citadel Lake again, looking at himself. Only he wasn't sure that the Phineas that he saw was really him; had he ever looked that determined and powerful in real life? He didn't know.

Afraid that the visions were going to overwhelm him, Phineas had gotten up. Not sure what else to do, he went back to the research materials that the three had used to write up their papers on river monsters. He soon found a book that had an entry on aboleths, and looked it over. He felt himself freeze up for a moment after reading one particular part; if Freja hadn't been able to get the severed tentacle to them as quickly as she had, it was likely that none of them would have been able to leave the lake. Once the "landbreather's curse" had established itself in its victim, it was almost impossible to dispel. He supposed he'd have to track the selkie down and thank her properly.

As he continued reading, he came upon something else that gave him pause. While a rare phenomenon, there were evidently some sorcerers who claimed that contact with an aboleth had awakened in them the potential to perform psychomancy, magic that could directly affect the mind. Skilled psychomancers could read minds and dominate the wills of their rivals, though the more benevolent of them used their magic to help others overcome trauma and recover lost memories. It was, like most magic, a discipline that could do both great good and great evil. And now Phineas might be able to use it.

Might was the keyword though. He'd have to do more research and maybe talk to some of his professors before he made that call. According to one text on the subject he dug out, it was easier to use psychomancy on those one had a deep emotional connection to. Which likely meant that the images he'd seen earlier had been taken from the minds of Ruby and Azul. It was thoughts about this first experience with psychomancy which ironically caused Phineas's mind to wander again like it had before. Soon, he came upon more ideas he'd never thought of before. A blue-haired woman who looked similar to Azul, hand on her belly and a radiant smile on his face. A sturdy-looking red-headed farmer, his eyes sparkling with pride as he watched his daughter get on a train to fulfill her potential. Azul staring longingly at Ruby before kissing her, their soft bodies pressing together-

Phineas tore himself away from the thoughts. Where the heck had that last impression come from? Because, yes, he could admit to himself that he did find his two friends very attractive. But seeing them together like that was... it wasn't something that had ever occurred to him. So where had it come from? Feeling frazzled, Phineas decided to try and go to sleep again and figure it out in the morning. Thankfully, no more nightmares troubled his rest, though he didn't feel particularly well-rested when the sun rose.

After a quick meal, he headed for the infirmary waiting room to meet Ruby and Azul as soon as the two girls were discharged. He definitely wanted to see them again, though he wasn't sure how exactly to broach the topic of his possible new affinity for psychic magic and the fact that he might have been reading their minds. Just a little. Still, he'd find a way. He was sure of it.

Then, the door to the infirmary opened, and out walked Ruby and Azul. The two plump witches looked tired, but otherwise fine. Phineas got up to join them, still wondering how to bring up his new ability as he was engulfed in a group hug.

The namesake Citadel of the Citadel Prepatory Academy for Rites & Sorcery was an immense fortress hidden away from the rest of the world. It had countless halls, courtyards and rooms. Many students warned against straying too far along less traveled hallways as it was very easy to get lost. The fortress was a boarding school, of course, providing every possible amenity to its students as they spent their formative years in one of the five dormitories.

Each dormitory selected its students from each incoming year. The process was vague, with contradictory explanations. All that was known was that by the time the students got off the locomotive in time for the Welcoming Festival, they had already been assigned to their dorms. Each dormitory banded together as a family of sorts, as they would compete with each other throughout the year in marks, sports and contests.

Each dormitory prided itself on its traits and accommodations. The dormitories were as follows:

Quanata Loft sported the wittiest, cleverest, and most imaginative students at the school. Those with the passions of learning and self-expression tended to make their way here in the cozy attic loft reaching towards the heavens. Their tastes were eclectic, as was the decor. Students with big dreams, new ideas, natural philosophers and those with an artistic eye made the loft a certainly eccentric place.

Wrocklehurst Cellar was an ancillary building in the Citadel with erstwhile students. Ones that made plenty of effort and didn’t take much credit for their efforts. Yet while none of the resident mages were stupid, there was the constant impression that ‘problem’ students ended up in the cellar. The reasons varied, from poor performance in one class, physical handicaps, or esoteric living arrangements needed as a result from obscure parentage. Wrocklehurst Cellar strived to make all welcome and had decidedly rustic architecture.

Meldelvian Dungeon had a gothic and sometimes sinister reputation. Those with interests in the macabre side of magic and a killer fashion sense crowded the gloom of the darkest dungeons. Many cultivated a frightening personality to make an impression. Few were inherently evil in this dormitory, although the stereotype of being the strange and scary kids did little to foster a positive image.

Vinixivue Tower championed have the best of the best. The most elite, the boldest, bravest and rising stars in the next generation of the magical world. The tower was one of the more imposing in the citadel, clade with opulence that spoke of past celebrities. It was a big name dormitory at the school, popular and prone to partying. Perhaps with a devil may care attitude, as many students of the dorm felt they could do no wrong.

Kunok Quarters, unlike many of the other dormitories, did not boast over having better accommodations or better students. The dorms were practical, simple and functional above all, never letting flash and panache get in the way of school life. Kunok students tended to be self disciplined and very loyal neighbors, drawing accolades from their collective efforts rather than a number of individual standouts. You were never without a friend or assistance at Kunok, or so it was said. As welcoming as they were Kunok was not the dorm to cross, as they could be as hard and resolute with a grudge as the stones of their corridors.


Although students tended to be associated with their dormitory for the rest of their life at the Citadel, the school also encouraged dormitory exchange. The upperclassmen were able to live in a different dormitory for the year. This helped broaden horizons and also brought new perspectives to the next generation of magic folk.

As Phineas Fortescue collected his luggage, he contemplated what the results of his dormitory exchange would be. He had been in Kunok Quarters since his first year at the Citadel. Unlike most of the dormitory he tended to keep to himself, staying out of the limelight. Phineas wasn't too sure about entering dormitory rotation. His family had suggested it, they thought it might help foster some ambition in him with a new outlook. Unlike his family's hopes, Phineas had a more dour outlook. Moving into a new dormitory would be such a change, he wasn't sure it would be for him.

Just where was Phineas Fortescue going to room this year?
