15.content:
The moment Phineas Fortescue had stepped off the locomotive at the Citadel's train station, he heard his name being called for over the bustle of the crowd.

"Urgent message for Phineas Fortescue! Urg-ent message for Phineas Fortescue!"

"Th-that's me," Phineas waved down the Citadel messenger. He was promptly given a rolled up parchment by the strange little imp who immediately began calling out another message. Phineas no longer paid attention to the imp's cry. He held the parchment nervously, unsure about opening it. He couldn't recall having done anything to get himself in trouble with the school authorities. If there had been a previous need for correspondence he would have received it at home over the summer.

Balking at the rolled up message wasn't going to get Phineas anywhere. Hesitantly, he unfurled the message and began reading:

"Dear Mr. Phineas Fortescue,
The Citadel Academy for Rites & Sorcery is pleased to inform you that your scholarship has been selected for advancement into apprentice studies. You are check in at administration for any changes in accommodations, and then report to your--"


Phineas took big gulps of air in surprise, going back to reread over the first few sentences again. He'd been made an apprentice?!

The Citadel shepherded students through eight years of magical education, with Phineas entering his penultimate or second to last. That was the majority of the student population. However, the Citadel also had its own version of graduate level coursework or apprenticeships to some of the most powerful wizards, witches, warlocks and other magical beings that taught at the school. Becoming an apprentice was an arduous, grueling task. Many students fancied themselves as being capable young magicians yet numerous failed to make the cut to work under the scrutinizing masters.

"There must be some sort of mistake," Phineas said to himself. Becoming an apprentice had sounded like so much work he had never considered it. Each master or mistress focused their apprentices on a specific niche of magic, studies that could extend life at the Citadel anywhere from an average of two to four years. That's if any of them survived. It was a rare but gruesome truth that in the past apprentices had gotten themselves killed from magical accidents or challenges they were not yet prepared for, amongst other dangers with learning such advanced magic directly from a master.

Phineas had certainly never signed himself up for it. Apprentices were commonly contacted during the summer and he had just received this message after getting off the train. Yet here the message was on official Citadel parchment. The fact that he was now an apprentice worried Phineas, as the risk far outweighed the positives in his mind. Apprentices were regarded with awe by the lesser study body, with access to privileges most at the Citadel didn't even know existed. It all depended on your master or mistress, each selective educator having their own quirks and reputation.

Cripes! Phineas hadn't finished reading the message yet. He still didn't know whomever he was pressed into apprenticeship for...
15.title: Phineas The Apprentice

choices: Bella Lovejoy
Gladia Storm
Misty Lune
151.content:
Phineas scanned the note one more time, but the only other real useful piece of information on it was the name of his Master - Janus Dao. Of course, that set off another wave of disbelief in Phineas's mind. Professor Dao was one of the foremost sorcerers in the world today, a wizard who focused his studies on the dualities inherent in many magical traditions. Fire & water, light & dark, life & death - Professor Janus had made many discoveries in how they interacted with each other. It was a great honor to be selected as his apprentice.

Of course Janus Dao, like many powerful magicians, had his own eccentricities. In Dao's case, it was an obsession with the number two. He always trained two apprentices when he took them on, and they either passed together or failed together. Which meant that if he screwed up now, it wouldn't only be his ass on the line anymore. Another student's future would now ride on how well Phineas did as an apprentice to one of the most renowned mages in the world. Phineas groaned as he felt his stress continue to build.

As he made his way towards the accommodations office, Phineas saw several other students moving along with him. All of them had been chosen by other powerful wizards to be their apprentices. All except one, who would be Phineas's parter. Phineas wondered who it might be. As his eyes roved over his classmates, three in particular caught his attention.

The first was Bella Lovejoy. She was one of the most popular girls in his year, because she was both incredibly smart and incredibly generous. She had helped many of her classmates who were struggling with their coursework without a second thought. In fact, Phineas was fairly sure he would have failed Intermediary Elementalism without her aid. She was also rather pretty, with blonde hair and blue eyes. Best of all, in Phineas's opinion, was her softness. Bella was known for having a sweet tooth, and many students had repaid her help by giving her candies and pastries. Phineas himself had gone ahead and gotten her an entire pie when she'd helped him, and to his surprise had eaten it all in front of him. Naturally, her hips had been getting wider as time went on. Yes, having Bella Lovejoy as a partner would be rather nice.

There was also Gladia Storm, who was widely considered to be the smartest girl in his year. She had consistently earned top marks in all of her classes, and excelled at any task she set her mind to. As one might expect, she was very competitive and abrasive, which explained why she was not as popular as Bella was. Gladia occasionally shot a dark look at the blonde, and Phineas knew she considered Bella one of her biggest academic rivals. What might happen if she turned that intensity on him? Phineas shuddered as he remembered how intense she could be when she competed with anyone. Her black hair, grey eyes, and lithe figure were considered attractive to many, but not to him. Yes, Phineas would rather not be paired with Gladia Storm.

The last of the others to catch his attention was Misty Lune. Misty was, in one word, a tease. She enjoyed joking and flirting with everyone around her, which made her the life of the party. She was never too mean-spirited about it, though, which was why she still as popular as she was. That and the fact that Misty Lune was widely considered to have one of the best pair of breasts on campus. Even Phineas, who preferred his woman with thicker waists than Misty had, could appreciate them. Misty's white hair and pale skin, products of her albinism, also gave her a mysterious air. Being partnered with Misty Lune could be interesting.

Finally, Phineas and the rest arrived in the accommodations office, which was already full. Not with other wizards, but with various animals, demons, and spirits. Familiars, Phineas realized, contracted servants of their new masters. Each of the assembled familiars had signs floating by them with names on them. The signs all had names written on them - the familiars would guide the new apprentices to their teachers. After looking around, Phineas finally found his name on a sign that was floating by a two-headed hellhound puppy. There was also another name on that sign:
151.title: The Two Apprentices

1513.content:
"Misty Lune?" Phineas read with surprise.

"Ah, Fortescue isn't it?" Misty Lune said. She was dressed smartly for the day of becoming an apprentice, making Phineas feel like he should have dressed up for the occasion, even though he had only just learned of this prestigious opportunity.

Misty wore sleek lavender and midnight purple robes, fitted around her impressive bust. Her milky white skin had a hint of blush from her blood, and she carried herself with an almost airy countenance.

Phineas gulped at the coy greeting. They weren't strangers by any means, although weren't friends either. Phineas and Misty had schooled together for many years, a frequent face in shared classes. There was a brief time, early in their second year when they were very much still children, that Misty had called Phineas her 'beaux' for half a semester. Puppy level crush that had not been one to last, one before Misty became a flirtatious partier and Phineas developed his attraction towards chubbier girls in their grade. Yet some of that old magnetism towards Misty had lingered, as she became quite beautiful with not only her face and charm but her natural figure with a perfect pair of breasts.

The reunion was broken by a trail of slobber spilled on Phineas' shoe from their joint familiar. Misty giggled as he struggled to wipe it off on the floor.

"So, Misty, I must admit I don't quite know why I'm here. Or why we're both in possession of a drooling orthus."

"I think she's cute," Misty said, bending to scratch behind the ears of the other head of the two headed puppy, more receptive to her presence.

"How do you know she's a sh--?" Phineas asked, although stopping himself as he noticed that he had a stunning view of Misty's pale cleavage given the position she took to pet the creature.

"She and he, Mr. Fortescue," spoke the sage tones of their new master, Janus Dao.

Phineas immediately straightened himself, not wanting his first impressions with the permanent sorcerer to be looking lustily at his co-ed fellow apprentice. The whole situation was still surreal to Phineas, although as a budding scholar he knew the honor of having this chance. Janus Dao had long grey hair tied in a bun with two chopsticks, along with an impressive mustache drooping on either side of his mouth towards his chin. His hands were folded in the sleeves of his exquisite robes. Dao's obsession with duality extended to his wardrobe as well, with each half of his robes having a different intricate pattern in contrasting color schemes, with accents of the opposite pattern on each part of the robe. It was a dizzying outfit to look at.

"Orthus are often born with male and female personalities in the same form," Janus Dao explained.

"And they are natural guardians," Misty said, also standing, cradling the two-headed pup close to her chest. "As hellhounds they patrol the barriers to the nether realms, and occasionally other areas of great magical significance."

"Yes, Miss Lune." Janus Dao regarded the both of them. "Together, you and Mr. Fortescue will be helping me research into the great dichotomies. And the balance of masculine and feminine is perfect with your position as my newest pair of apprentices and your familiar's own two sexes."

"Excuse me?" Phineas said with a nervous, small sound that made Misty giggle. Phineas didn't consider himself the strongest, handsome, or bravest and as such not the obvious example of masculinity, short of his gender.

"Do not downplay your accomplishments, Mr. Fortescue," Janus Dao explained. "While others of your year have accolades to their name that you do not, you have shown a consistent intelligence and stellar ethics towards your coursework that is suitably for this level of magical advancement." He turned to Misty. "And Miss Lune has a vitality and exuberance towards life, society and magic that finds enjoyment in all she does. Together I could consider no better pairing given your aptitudes."

Misty smiled and Phineas just grinned, thinking there had to be more to it than that. Yet the crowd of apprentices in the accommodations office shifted, as various academics and their personal pupils settled into arrangements and gathered familiars. Janus Dao spoke briefly as to what life for Phineas and Misty would now mean, as there were many elements of schedule and logistics to work out.

Soon the pair of fresh apprentices were lefty alone. Long enough that Misty dropped her smile and sneezed.

"Are you alright?" Phineas asked.

"Of course, *ACHOO*" Misty rubbed her nose, which only made the sneezing fit worse, as the hellhound pup was thrust into Phineas' hands.

He looked at the two heads of the orthus unsure as to the expression of the brother-sister heads as they were upset at the sudden movement. And then a thought came to him.

"Are you allergenic to orthus?" Phineas asked Misty as she pulled a handkerchief out from under her left breast.

"n-N-no..." she replied after blowing her nose, although Phineas could see that her eyes had watered.

If Phineas had to guess, maybe Misty was as ill-prepared for this apprenticeship with Janus Dao as he was feeling. Only that was just the beginning, as Phineas and Misty soon learned the full terms of this apprenticeship.
1513.title: A Pair and a Pup

choices: The panaceaberries end up interacting weirdly with something Misty ate.
Phineas and Misty get into a conflict with Professor Dao's other new students.

15131.content:
Phineas and Misty made their way through the Citadel after being dismissed by Professor Dao (Master Dao Phineas reminded himself, since he needed to get used to the proper forms of address he'd need to use as an apprentice), as the mustachioed wizard had needed to talk to the other pair of apprentices he'd taken on this year. Phineas carried the yet-to-be-named two-headed puppy against his chest, both heads looking about while their tongues lolled out of their mouths. Misty, meanwhile, was taking care of the luggage, levitating both her and Phineas's bags without any noticeable effort.

Soon, they found themselves at their destination; Quanata Loft, the dormitory that was home to some of the Citadel's most brilliant and most eccentric students. It was little surprise to Phineas that this had been Professor Master Dao's home when he'd been a student at the Citadel. It was also where he housed the students apprenticed to him, one of the agreements he had with the school as a teacher in the mentorship program. And now Phineas was moving here, after years of hoping he could be here! Today was getting better and better.

The two hadn't been there long before the pair were approached by a young woman who looked oddly familiar to Phineas. Misty enveloped the newcomer in a hug, and they chatted for a bit before the other woman inquired about him.

"Ah, I suppose introductions are in order. May, this is my partner apprentice, Phineas Fortescue, formerly of Kunok Quarters. Phineas, this is May Tresfluer, future archdruid and my roommate last year," Misty said with melodramatic flourishes. Well, that explained why she looked familiar. May's sister, Siv Tresfluer, had been one of his dormmates back when he'd lived at Kunok Quarters.

May rolled her eyes, apparently used to this behavior. "I would like to apologize to you on Misty's behalf, Fortescue. I promise you that not all students here in the Loft are as crazy as she is." Misty stuck her tongue out at May, but didn't exactly refute the characterization.

"Oh, that's, uh..." Phineas began, before deciding to change the topic. "It's actually really nice up here. I've wanted to move to Quanata for years now. I guess me and the doggy here will get settled soon enough."

At the mention of the dog, May looked closer at it, then moved up close to her former roommate to stare at Misty for a long moment. Misty didn't move at the invasion of her personal space, evidently as used to May's quirks as May was to her own. The druid-in-training held up a finger to Misty, then walked over towards the girls' dorms. She soon returned with a potted plant, a small bush upon which several small berries were growing.

"This is a panaceaberry bush," May explained as she handed the pot to Misty. "Eat one of those each morning, and they'll help with your allergy symptoms."

"Are you sure?" Misty gasped, looking genuinely touched at the offered plant.

"You said you're apprenticing under Professor Dao, right? You want to be at 100% if you want to succeed at whatever lessons he throws at you. And what kind of friend would I be if I let you suffer when I could help? Besides, I can always grow more of them," May responded.

Misty took the plant, picked one of the berries off, and popped it into her mouth. After a moment, she set the plant down, and tentatively gestured Phineas to hand her the two-headed puppy. The albino witch held the little dog in her arms for a few moments, but no sneezing took place. The pups did take the opportunity to cover her with slobbery kisses. Giggling, Misty handed the pooch back to Phineas, and used a quick cleaning cantrip to get the dog saliva off of her face.

"Looks like that's taken care of," May said. "Just be careful about what you eat. Panaceaberries can have some... odd interactions with certain foods. If you like, I can-"

"Thanks, May, but I think I'll be fine. Phineas and I still have to get our room set up," Misty said.

May shrugged. "If you say so. I'll be around if you have any other questions. I'll talk to you both later." And with that, the student druid headed off, and Phineas and Misty were soon busy with their own tasks. Specifically, setting up the room that they would both share in the wing of Quanata Loft specifically set aside for apprentices. Phineas was rather hesitant when he saw that he would indeed be sleeping in the same room as Misty, though each did have their own bed. In-between both of the beds was a small doggy bed, which the two-headed puppy curled up on.

"I must admit, this is a little more... intimate than I was expecting..." Phineas said as he unpacked his clothes into one of the dressers.

"I think I'm the one who's supposed to say that," Misty responded as she set her newly-acquired panaceaberry bush on the nightstand beside her table.

"Really? That's not what May said," Phineas asked, trying to be a little daring and tease Misty back.

Misty laughed out loud at that. "Anyway, I'm sure it will be fine, Phineas. I know you. You're a good guy."

"Oh, uh... thanks," Phineas blushed at the straightforward compliment, and went back to unpacking. As he did, his mind wandered back to the instructions Professor Master Dao had given them.

"Consider this orthrus puppy your first true test. I have found that living in proximity and needing to work towards the same goal will either break a team apart or create a bond that will enable you to rely on each other for everything. I will check on your progress with the puppy a month from now. If you have trained it to my satisfaction, then the real apprenticeship will begin."

Phineas looked back the sleeping puppy. Well, half-sleeping at this point; one of the heads was still snoozing, while the other (the female head, Phineas thought) was looking at him curiously. Everything about both his and Misty's future apprenticeship rested on that puppy. He just hoped that he and his partner would be able to meet Master Dao's expectations.

The first night at the shared room in Quanata Loft didn't actually go all that badly, Phineas thought. Soon, though, the two new apprentices would have to face an unexpected challenge.

15133.content:
In two weeks time, Phineas Fortescue and Misty Lune would begin their biggest trial under their master, Janus Dao. The grandmasters of the Citadel had their own number of apprentices and their own methods of training them. Given his obsession with dualities and the number two, Dao trained pairs of apprentices and as such had one of the larger rosters of personal students, yet there was very little interaction given the specific polarities each set of partners were studying. His other pair of newcomers this year were a pair of witches, one bubbly and one morose, furthering his research into light and dark magicks while it was rumored that an older pair of apprentices, ones mastering the elements of fire and water, couldn't get along and were very close to failing if they didn't shape up this year.

Phineas still wasn't quite sure what he and Misty would be doing in master Janus Dao's lessons. He had paired them specially as male and female, down to a sister-brother two headed hellhound (with the female as the right head of the orthus, the male as the left head). And while this brought Phineas into close proximity with the opposite sex, one he knew and found rather attractive in personality and physique, the implications troubled his indecisive, hormone addled and introspective tendencies.

"Have you thought of names yet," Misty asked him.

"Huh?" Phineas snapped out of his thoughts. He and Misty had met up during a nursing session for the hellhound, until their final living arrangements as apprentices were finalized.

"Names for our dear familiar when we present them to master Dao," Misty giggled. "You're such a scatterbrain, Fortescue."

"Oh, right." It was bit perplexing for him to think of their shared familiar as two personalities in the same body, a bit of article confusion that he would have to get used to. "I'm not too sure with two names."

"We could always go with the classics," Misty said as she stooped down with two bottles of formula, Phineas begrudgingly trying to keep the heads apart so they could be properly fed. "There's Artemis and Apollo," she suggested.

"The twin gods, yeah, url--" Phineas had to move his hand quickly before it got bit by the male head. "I had thought of Artemis as both males and females have had the name, but if we need two for the orthus..."

"Or there's Eros and Psyche, if you'd prefer."

"Isn't that the god of sex and--" Phineas felt his face grow crimson. In Greek Mythology Eros and Psyche had been the most notable lovers. Misty's eyes were level with his, jittering a bit slightly due to her albinism, but full of mirth and a spark of amusement at making Phineas so uncomfortable.

And then the moment ended suddenly as Misty stood up to sneeze.

Phineas was left scrambling to keep the bottles of formula at each head of the hellhound. "A-Are you alright, Misty?"

"Oh, I'll be alright," she said with a stuffed noised, teary eyed, as she fished for her handkerchief from her bosom again to dry at her eyes and clear her sinuses. Despite the sudden jolt of her sneeze Phineas had witness her perk breasts bounce majestically from the motion, and image he would keep in mind when alone.

"But if you're allergic, how exactly are we going to make this work out?"

Misty's eyes, usually somewhat colorless, were growing red from the sinus aggravation. "We never did keep pets at home after my parents once got me a puppy. It was its fine fur, you see, it causes irritation and puffiness."

Now that his attention was brought to it, Phineas could see that Misty was looking puffy. Her cheeks were a smidge wider, hinting that hers would be an aptly named moonface if she ever put on weight above her bust line. Her arms and fingers also looked a bit puffy, and maybe he was imagining it but her clothes looked a little ill fitting.

"Like swelling?" Phineas suggested.

"Somewhat," Misty said. "I'm generally better with dogs once they've grown older, less shedding." She blew her nose. "Orthus grow up fast but in all honesty I may have to ask you to handle more of the nursing *AAACHOO!*"

"We'll sort it out, don't worry," Phineas replied, mind already racing with responsibilities and possibilities. "Things will shape up before we enter our trials with Master Dao. In fact, do we have more formula?"

Passing to a sink to wash her handkerchief, Misty said, "Yes...why?"

After the two heads were fed, Phineas got up to root around the medicines in the cabinet in their stall where young familiars were kept. "Well, whenever me or my brothers and sisters would get a cold, mum would usually put our medicine in milk. The only home remedy I know, really."

"At this point I'm willing to try anything," Misty said, "I suppose this is close enough."

A strong dose of allergy medicine was added to the nutrient rich, milky formula the pair of fresh apprentices were using as Phineas gave the glass to Misty. "Bottoms up, as they say," she replied, thanking Phineas.

Seeing the milky skinned, white haired Misty Lune drink the medicine through the thick formulae, Phineas was hit with a spark of inspiration. "What if we went Persian on names? Like Zaal and Rudabeh?"

"From the epic of Shahnameh?" Misty mused. "Hmm, I'm not against it. The source names are contrary to our own complexions, wouldn't you say."

"It would be our own twist on it, ah," Phineas found himself losing his voice, unable to vocalize to Misty that she had a drip of formula running from her lips to the prestigious swell of her right breast.

153.content:
Your future patron will contact you after your report to the 5th sanctum

Patron? The 5th Sanctum? Warning bells were sounding off in Phineas' head. This was worse than being thrust into an apprenticeship without advance notice. But Phineas was tasked to apprentice to a new patron?

There were many spheres of magic, and innate magical power sufficed most through their lives as witches and wizards at both the Citadel and the rest of their lives. But Warlocks were of note as well. It wasn't forbidden knowledge, rather an uncommon occurrence, where magic practitioners made pacts with magical entities for more power. One could argue that the acolytes of the holy, divine 'gods' who altered their magic through devotion and worship was the more acceptable practice.

But Phineas had been sent to report at the 5th Sanctum, a justly named five times warded bastion where both professors and students at this level contacted the strangest realms known to magic. Areas that, with one wrong incantation or lack of fortitude, might spell the doom of the entire Citadel let alone the world!

And how had Phineas been made an apprentice in this way? Surely this must be some sort of mistake! Once Phineas had arrived at the cloistered entrance to the 5th Sanctum, he told the proctor in charge of admittance that they must have the wrong student.

"Fortescue, Phineas," the proctor read from a scroll. "No, you have indeed been summoned. Requested, in fact."

Phineas gulped. "Requested? By whom, what?"

The proctor just stared at him. "Discretion is of upmost importance with the 5th Sanctum. You will be protected during your contact within these walls, but we can no more explain to you the aspects of your patron better than they can explain it."

Phineas felt his stomach turn into a knot. This did not sound like it was in his skillset at all! This was a task for a different Fortescue!

"Come this way." The proctor led Phineas past an unsealed vault door into the 5th Sanctum. Low light glowed from flameless candles set in sconces along the strong, heavy pillars in the Sanctum, the very foundations of the greater Citadel in some respects. He was told to stand in the center of a large, warded circle.

Phineas could identify the glyphs along the circle for the most part, noticing ones of protection, summoning, and transportation but unable to discern the target realm this circle contacted. Overwhelmed, Phineas tried to protest but he was too late, the runes of the circle glowed brightly and Phineas found his consciousness shifted.

----

"Welcome, young Phineas! I shall be your new teacher!"

Whatever Phineas could have possibly thought of, whatever he had feared, absolute nothing could have prepared Phineas for what he found within the magic circle.

Especially not a classroom. Rather, the simple furniture of a classroom. A student's desk, a professor's desk, a blackboard.

And that was before he could fully comprehend the razor-toothed, golden eyed, fuzzy black demon lady looking back at him.

"...teacher?" was all Phineas could mouth.

He was doubly surprised that this response appeared to catch the demon off guard as well. "Is it too much? The graduation robes, the mortarboard? Definitely the latter, I knew I didn't have the horns to pull it off."

Horns was the understatement of the year as said by this husky voiced, feminine demon, as she looked to have a pair of antlers! The tassel of the mortarboard got caught as she tried to extract it from her head.

"Oh, close your mouth kid, I wasn't trying to scare you or anything. Think of our future prospects like any other of your classes. Only with a vastly different commute."

Politeness and sincerity is not what Phineas expected to experience when talking to a demon, let alone so casual of conversation. "I'm sorry, wait, what is going on here? Why do you want to teach me?"

"Have a seat, Phin. That cool for a nickname? 'Forts' sounds way too dorky," the antlered demon turned to hang up her robes on a coat rack made of bone spurs Phineas hadn't seen earlier.

As Phineas took the offered seat at the student's desk, he got a full look at his patron. A real full look.

"I like keeping things as casual as possible, Phin, so don't worry your mind all that much about the infernal magicks at work." Instead of taking her chair behind the desk, this demonic patron sat on the deck. Although she could have passed for remaining unclothed given the thick, scratchy black fur along most of her body, she was tightly squeezed into a vest that gave shape to her curves. Plump chested and tremendously hip heavy. Phineas found himself starring at how each mammoth cheek of her weighty but and thighs overhung the corner of ornate professor's desk.

The demon caught him staring. "Mm, my form is pleasurable to you?"

Phineas was both horribly ashamed and aroused at the same time, trying to gather his thoughts. "Are you--some sort of succubus?"

"Am I a succubus?" the demon lady laughed, a mirthful jiggle in her lower regions. "Oh, that's a good one Phin kid. You're too kind, no really."

"I--huh?" Phineas, in the entirety of his magical education at the Citadel, had never expected his life would take a turn like this.

"Let me cut straight to the chase, kid. I need someone of your predilections to get me out of a jam. That which inflames your passions; The allure of a weighty female."

Phineas coughed. THAT's what this mysterious apprenticeship was about??!

"Desperate times call for desperate measures," the demonic patron said, introducing herself. "My name is Hesbeth. Although you can call me Beth, probably won't raise as many flags if you refer to me as such in the mortal realm. Co-Sloth and Gluttony demon."

"Hes-err, Beth?" Phineas was confused. The demon's name was Beth? "Co-Sloth and Gluttony demon?"

"I'm going to let you in on a little secret, Phin kid. You know of the demonic hells, places of internal punishment and booming figures of pain, hate, and monstrous appearances? That's us overplaying it, making a show out of the lower reaches. The demonic hells have become far more bureaucratic as of late. And the flow of demonic power comes down to a simple equation. We encourage sin to be spread throughout the world to gain power from the acts of sin in others. More sin, more power, capiche?"

"I, think I understand," Phineas said.

"But there's been some, restructuring," Hesbeth or Beth continued, "us demons used to have to worry only about one category of sins. Too much overhead, it turned out, and a lot of departments were culled. So although I stated out as a demon of Sloth, I got into the Gluttony gig as well after several jobs with that sin. Which is where you come in, my new and only student."

"Me?"

"It's simple, Phin kid. I need you to advance the cause of Sloth and Gluttony. I'm sure that latter one is right up your alley. That increased sin will get me more power, and more influence for your future lessons. Its a deal we can all benefit from."

Phineas had to be sure he was hearing this right. A glowing eyed, antlered, bottom-heavy fuzzy demon wanted him as a student to further the sins of Sloth and Gluttony?

"You get to live out your fantasies and I'll teach you magic no one has dreamed of yet. That is a pretty sweet deal, kid."

"Isn't there a catch?" It was said to be weary dealing with demons, as they always had ulterior motives. As much as the full explanation somewhat excited Phineas, he was ever a cautious one.

"No catch," Hesbeth said. "Well, not one that's easily explained from your side of the equation. Think of it more as forging new ground. As long as you magic folk have contacted demons, its been a even heavier workload trying to damn your souls along with that of the magic-less populace. I'm willing to bet there's a more lucrative avenue of sin to be had if I have a student, a partner on the other side to advance the cause more subtlety than the next 'Demonic Dark Lord' that gets his ass handed to him by a bunch of heroic champions."

As much as Hesbeth was downplaying this arrangement, Phineas couldn't help but think of the complications. Yet, for once in his life Phineas felt that his attraction wasn't something to be embarrassed by. If he looked at it like any other apprenticeship prospect, his 'predilections' as described by this patron had made him as viable a candidate no different than needing high marks in dueling or runes, for example.

After a long pause of weighing his options, Phineas gave in. "Alright, I'm in."

"Perfect!" Hesbeth lumbered off her desk. "I could squeeze you right now, kid, but its only our first meeting."

"Squeeze?"

"Sorry, hug. That's what you heart-havers call it, right?"

"Heart-havers?"

"Now we're just getting distracted," Hesbeth said, scratching behind one of her antler-horns. "The Citadel where you school isn't aware of what our arrangement actually entails, so you need to keep it on the down low. Start looking for people with sins that need attention. Areas where a hint of Sloth and a pinch of Gluttony can take hold. Make friends."

"I guess I can do that, although what do you mean by future lessons?"

"That'll be scheduled in future, once you've opened some avenues, Phin kid. Remember to keep this on the hush."

"Ok, Professor, umm, Hesbeth."

"Beth, kid," Beth corrected. "Draws less attention my way."

"Sorry, Beth," Phineas said, as the sudden lurch of magic brought him back into the 5th Sanctum under the Citadel, his demonic patron having disappeared.

Being back at the familiar Citadel was a little disorientating, although now Phineas had been entrusted with a special mission, one that played to his desires. His life was about to change.

1533.content:
After meeting with his new teacher, Phineas decided he needed some time to figure out how to feel about his new situation. The reedy young wizard eventually found himself sitting down in one of the Citadel's many courtyards, and he proceeded to think. There was a part of him that was very happy about the kinds of assignments Hesbeth was going to have him do, but it was currently being shouted at by the part of him that was afraid of putting himself into social situations and the part of him that remembered what the usual fate of people who made deals with demons was.

"Penny for your thoughts, Fortescue?"

The question brought Phineas's inner argument to a screeching halt, and he looked up at the one who asked it. "Oh, Charity. Sorry, I didn't notice you there."

Charity Brightbell was one of the more distinctive students at the Citadel, on account of her being a tiefling. While some of the fiendish-blooded folk could pass for a regular human, Charity's hellish heritage manifested itself in her lavender-colored skin, solid red eyes, her dark violet horns, and her tail. Her long black hair was tied back into a loose ponytail, and she was currently dressed in casual clothes which did little to disguise her general chubbiness; she had caught Phineas's wandering eye more than once.

"You looked like you were deep in thought there. Let me guess..." Charity said, before leaning over so her face was inches away from Phineas's, her cleavage on the same level as his eyes. She then whispered, "You're wondering how to fulfill your obligations to your new teacher."

Phineas leaned away from her in surprise. "How do you know about that?" he gasped.

Charity chuckled. "Why, because dear old Grandma Beth told me." She paused for a moment, musing. "Well, technically Great-Great-Great-Great-Grandma, but that's splitting hairs."

Phineas stared at her a moment, as his mind processed what she'd just said. "You mean, you're..."

Charity nodded and pre-emptively answered, "Yup. I'm the first one in the family who took after her in several generations. Mom & Dad wanted to keep me hidden away, but Grandma Beth always had a soft spot for me. Well, as much as someone in her line of work can have a soft spot for anyone, I guess."

"So..." Phineas said after some more thought, "You know about my... uh, apprenticeship. So what brings you over here?"

"Weeeeeell," Charity replied, her tail swishing behind her, "I maaaaaay owe Grandma Beth a favor for... it's not important. Anyway, she told me she thought you had potential, but that you might need some convincing to accept the apprenticeship. So, if I can get you to make your mind up, she'll consider my debt to her squared away."

"You're... being awfully blunt about this," Phineas pointed out.

"I'm only about 2% demon. I never claimed to be great at the whole 'tempting' thing," Charity answered with a shrug. "But, I do think you should take her up her offer. Grandma Beth's been around a long time, and has forgotten more about magic than we'll ever learn. Despite how many wizards summon demons to learn about magic, an arrangement like her's is actually pretty rare. And if she thinks you can hack being her student, then you definitely can, if that's what you're worried about."

"I already told her I'd be her student. I'm not the kind of guy who goes back on his word," Phineas said, a little offended she thought so little of him.

Charity raised her hands. "Yikes. Sorry, didn't realize you'd already made up your mind."

"It's... it's fine. Thanks. For, uh, telling me my new teacher believes in me, I guess," Phineas said.

"But... Now that I think about it, I guess I still owe you, don't I? For helping me out last year," Charity mused. The help the tubby tiefling was referring to happened during a Magical Theory class the two had shared the year before. Charity had been having trouble with some of the more esoteric concepts covered in the class, and after failing a test had asked Phineas, one of the better-performing and more approachable students, to help her bring her grade up. Phineas's tutoring had helped raise Charity's grade from failing to solidly middle-of-the-class, and she'd promised him after seeing her final grade that she'd find a way to repay the favor.

"I told you last year, you don't need to worry about that. I was happy I could help," Phineas patiently explained.

"And I told you last year, I always balance the scales," Charity responded, equally as patient. "Besides, tell me you don't want any help with whatever Grandma Beth wants you to do."

Phineas found that he could not tell her that, and sighed. "Fine. I guess I really could use a hand."

"Great!" Charity said with a sharp-toothed smile. "Now, knowing what Grandma Beth's job entails, it probably relates to sloth or gluttony, right?"

"Something like that," Phineas said.

"So, how can I help?" Charity asked.

15333.content:
The idea seemed to strike at Phineas out of nowhere, and he decided to ask before he completely lost his nerve. "Well, do you want to get dinner?"

Charity just looked at him for a moment, apparently taken entirely off-guard by Phineas's question. Then she laughed. It started off as chuckling, but soon Charity was letting out a loud belly laugh, which caused all of her to start shaking. Phineas wasn't entirely sure what was going on, so he remained where he was, doing his best not to stare too much at the tiefling's jigglier parts.

Finally, Charity got herself under control. "Gotta say, Fortescue, I didn't realize you were that ballsy," Charity said, wiping a tear out of her eye.

That wasn't exactly what Phineas had been hoping to hear, but it wasn't an outright rejection either. So he decided to push his luck. "Is that a yes? Or..."

Charity looked like she might start laughing again, but she managed to stop herself. "You know what? Dinner sounds nice. I'm guessing we've still got to unpack, so I'll meet you at the Great Hall at 7, alright?"

"Yeah. See you then," Phineas said. With that, Charity headed off. It took an effort of will for Phineas to tear his eyes away from the tiefling's swaying backside, but he knew he'd need to finish moving. Like in his previous years of schooling, it looked like he'd be back in Kunok Quarters. Hesbeth had told him that staying there would enable him to keep a low profile better, and so back to Kunok Phineas would go.

Soon enough it was 7:00, and Phineas and Charity found themselves in the Great Hall. Phineas had actually gone all the way down to the Meldelvian Dungeons, the dorm where Charity lived, to get her. She was bemused when she saw him at first, but quickly fell into place alongside Phineas like she'd known him meeting her would be the plan the whole time. Phineas found that conversation came easy with Charity, though he wondered how much of that was because he felt he didn't need to keep his new teacher a secret from her. After they got to their destination, it was a matter of loading their plates and finding a place to sit.

Phineas did his best not to stare when Charity sat down with a plate laden with all kinds of foods. Pasta, steak, greens, several chicken wings, and more. The grin she shot him indicated she'd noticed anyway. Then, the two laid into their dinner. Though Phineas hadn't gotten that much food for himself, he still found that he finished around the same time Charity had. The tiefling let out a sigh of contentment as she polished off the last speck of food on her plate.

Since not overthinking his ideas had been working for him so far, Phineas decided to go for it. "Do you want seconds?"

Charity look at him with a raised eyebrow, but soon a mischievous smile appeared on her lips. "You know what? I do. Thanks."

So, Phineas got up, and filled up another plate with everything that Charity had put on her plate before sitting down. He soon found his way back to the small table they shared, setting down the second dinner in front of her. Charity looked at the plate, then back to Phineas, a smile still on her face. "Don't want you wasting away," Phineas said, hoping the line came out as smooth as it had sounded in his head.

Charity laughed out loud, and then dug into her second dinner. She wasn't quite the eating machine she had been the first time around, starting to waver about halfway through her second course. Still, she managed to clean her plate again, though Phineas noted that her belly was quite bloated. He could even see some lavender midriff where her shirt wasn't quite up to containing the tiefling's tummy. And after all that, she was still up for some dessert, polishing off the slice of cheesecake that she asked Phineas to bring her.

But all good things must come to an end, and soon Phineas found himself helping Charity back to the dungeons. Again, the action was not something that Charity seemed to have been anticipating, but she that she nonetheless appreciated. At the doors of Meldelvian Dungeon, Charity pulled Phineas into a hug, and whispered something into his ear. Phineas couldn't quite understand what it was, his brain focused on keeping himself upright as he felt himself pressed into a softness he very much appreciated.

Phineas hoped the smile on his face wasn't too goofy as he made his way back to Kunok Quarters. Today had gone rather well, and he was actually looking forward to the future for once. Maybe Hesbeth's belief in him wasn't misplaced.

info.description:
The following is a weight gain and expansion related story set at the Citadel Preparatory Academy for Rites and Sorcery. The Citadel is a mysterious fortress set away from the rest of the world where the extensive study of magic occurs for the next generations of witches, wizards and warlocks. At this preeminent magic school we have our teenage protagonist Phineas Fortescue, an otherwise unremarkable young magician about to enter his penultimate year in magic studies.

Phineas has been a lifelong closeted fat admirer thus far into his magical education. The story enters his life as his private fantasies become realized, as he could potentially meet the weighty love of his life. Several weighty loves, actually, all vying for his affections. School drama and wayward magic coincides with several romance options with the gaining, overweight and massive females the Citadel has to offer.

Against this tale of love of weight gain, the Citadel is a cosmopolitan magic academy where just about anything is possible. Inspirations include not only Hogwarts from the Harry Potter series but also Unseen University from the Discworld series and the magic of Dungeons & Dragons, amongst other inspirations.

Before we begin, a few guidelines:

Central Character: Phineas' life as a fat admirer and expansion enthusiast is a cornerstone of the story. Should the focus of a storyline drift away from having Phineas as a main character, his presence should still remain central to the plot.

Feminine Weight Gain: Although the Citadel is a co-ed magical education facility, the other main emphasis of the story is on female weight gain. This is not to sale fat males are non-existent or male gain is forbidden, but it would only be allowed from a mutual gaining scenario.

Restrain Magic: Magic is an important part of the series, allowing many magical, supernatural or occult means of weight gain and expansion. While magic follows deliberate patterns and paradoxically still cannot be fully explained, as exceptions to the 'rules' always exist, magic should not be leaned on as the easy solution. It takes a lot of magical power to trigger spectacular events, so refrain from massive instantaneous gains and such if there is no significance to the act.

Write Your Best: I encourage you to write your best and be creative. I may pass through chapters to fix typos or add chapter prompt options but I will not overwrite your additions.

However...

Just because this story is harem genre, it is not a free pass for overly explicit entries. In regards to potential girlfriends for Phineas (17 at the start of the story) the youngest any love interest can be is 15.

Please mind the overall rating of the piece, 13+, when crafting your addition.
